question: An Australian friend is coming to visit you, and it will be his/her birthday during the visit. Write a letter to your friend. In your letter:•  say how you feel about the visit?•  suggest what you could do on his/her birthday?•  ask what your friend thinks of your idea?Write at least 150 wordsYou do not need to write any addressesBegin your letter as followsDear….
text: I hope this letter finds you well. I am thrilled and excited about your visit and I feel over the moon.
It's been a long time since we did not meet after  graduation and I am sure that your sudden visit to my place will bring all memories back.

We have a big party hall at our place and thinking of throwing a lavish party for all near and dear ones and this would be a phenomenal event during your visit. In addition, I am planning to extend the party invitation to all of our friends and school teachers. If possible right after our party we will be donating a  few funds to charity.

As you heard about the parties and gatherings what do we want to make it up  I would like to know  your thoughts  as well. It is not easy to execute the plan without your ideas too. Hence, please do not hesitate to add your points or suggestions if any.
I cannot wait anymore to see you. Please send me your travel plan to arrange a great welcome meeting at the airport.
